metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5198 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
V8 in Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.90 for Linux, and 54.0.2840.85 for Android, and 54.0.2840.87 for Windows and Mac included incorrect optimisation assumptions, which allowed a remote attacker to perform arbitrary read/write operations, leading to code execution, via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
